channel.title: Cheap media center computer
channel.description:
I think I just made one for a very good deal for my parents (to use as a media computer, so they can download movies and watch them on their TV without burning them to DVDs), though I don't think it would be too shabby for gaming for the price:
[img]http://img520.imageshack.us/img520/7689/momscomp.png[/img]
That also doesn't count the $40 in mail in rebates, so the whole computer cost about $200, not too shabby I think.
(the hard drive that I was forced to buy with the combo was a Western Digital, so of course it was DOA (Dead on Arrival) and just made a clicking sound, so I have to RMA that and hope the next is better)
What do you guys think?

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ah true, it probably is faster on spyware infected technophobe-pcs

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

odd, ive always found kubuntu way slower than windows

It’s always been faster for me, especially with all the spyware my parents always had. (also on srt8’s older laptop)

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled:

Put a mac theme on kubuntu and tell them it’s a mac

No need, I’ve actually already had them converted to using kubuntu for about a year or so now after they got tired of dealing with painfully slow windows. I’m just not sure about how well the linux ATI drivers will work with this setup, if they don’t we may have to go windows

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Put a mac theme on kubuntu and tell them it’s a mac

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:290588”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=384171.msg2884109#msg2884109 date=1248491918]
What are you going to do about software? I’m assuming you’ll run some simplified version of Linux made specifically for Media Streaming/Downloading?
[/quote]

While I’m waiting on the new hard drive to come I’m just playing with it and an extra 80gb laptop harddrive I had laying around, I got OSX Leopard to install on it without a problem, and verified for all of those people who say ‘moparscape doesn’t work on a mac’ that it in fact, does :P.

For the actual finished product I’ll probably install Windows 8 RC (never used it before) and kubuntu in a dual boot arrangement, only because I don’t count on the ATI drivers for linux supporting a decent resolution, if they support HDMI at all.[/quote]
You mean Windows 7?
Also, very nice, especially for that price!

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Elijah:

What are you going to do about software? I’m assuming you’ll run some simplified version of Linux made specifically for Media Streaming/Downloading?

While I’m waiting on the new hard drive to come I’m just playing with it and an extra 80gb laptop harddrive I had laying around, I got OSX Leopard to install on it without a problem, and verified for all of those people who say ‘moparscape doesn’t work on a mac’ that it in fact, does :P.

For the actual finished product I’ll probably install Windows 8 RC (never used it before) and kubuntu in a dual boot arrangement, only because I don’t count on the ATI drivers for linux supporting a decent resolution, if they support HDMI at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

What are you going to do about software? I’m assuming you’ll run some simplified version of Linux made specifically for Media Streaming/Downloading?

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

la­wl:

is whatever graphics card in there capable of playing HD video?

I assume so because it has HDMI out, my parents have a 720p TV I am going to hook it up to so I’m sure it will be able to handle it alright.

[quote=“xEnt, post:10, topic:290588”]As for that computer, i think you should get some low end graphics card (like someone said, a 9400gt) or something that’s not onboard. Not sure if you need that CPU cooler tbh i doubt your going to overclock, the rest is fine.

thats amazing how fucking cheap you guys get stuff, i assume thats newegg? something like that in australia would be worth about 400$ USD.[/quote]

I just honestly don’t think they need a better graphics card for only watching movies, not to mention then I would have to run a separate audio cable whereas now the video and audio both comes out the same HDMI port.

And I had to get the CPU cooler because the CPU came OEM, meaning no fan or heatsink came with it.

It’s the cheapest I’ve seen too, it was just a combo price I got in my email and I thought it would be a great deal for my parents as a media center PC. Not counting the video card, it’s equal or perhaps slightly better than my rig…

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Normally i like WD, but theres a reason i have a 640gb, 80gb, 40gb, 30gb and 20gb WD hdds in the cupboard behind me sitting there.

Have never tried seagate, but i do like maxtor and samsung hdds.

As for that computer, i think you should get some low end graphics card (like someone said, a 9400gt) or something that’s not onboard. Not sure if you need that CPU cooler tbh i doubt your going to overclock, the rest is fine.

thats amazing how fucking cheap you guys get stuff, i assume thats newegg? something like that in australia would be worth about 400$ USD.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

is whatever graphics card in there capable of playing HD video?

also, how the fuck do you have such bad luck with western digital, ive never heard of anyone else having trouble

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Im a Western Digital Fan Boy. I have one (200GB) for 3 and a half years and it has not put a foot wrong.
@ DOA, maybe the person transporting it was retarded. I personally am really careful with 3.5" drives after ruining one before.

Moparisthebest, How can all this stuff be so cheap! In the United Kingdom you would never get anything like that for $250, which is about £150.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

While we’re ranting about WD drives…I have 160gb WD in my comp, and it grinds like metal scraping on concrete when the computer boots. The data is fine, and not too many bad sectors or anything, but man it makes a racket.
On the other hand, I’ve have a 320gb Seagate that has been running perfectly since the day I bought it, 2+ years ago.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

My root drive is still a 40gb WD, touch wood still going after however many years.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I think you have something against WD MOparisthebest Ive ordered about 6 hardrives from newegg to replace segates that have gone out in my dells around a year after I bought them and the WD haven’t had any problems yet. They are and remain the only harddrives I will ever buy. But a tip I always read the reviews on the drives before I buy them to make sure that it won’t be a shitty one. Maybe you just have bad luck with DOA wd harddrives?

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Let me clarify, everything except the case and the cooling fan came as a combo, so I didn’t have a choice in it.

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:2, topic:290588”]media center box? could go with some more storage.

well, depends on how avid your parents are i guess (now that i think of it i dont see them saving hundreds of gb of movies)[/quote]

Normally I would agree, but I don’t see them saving a bunch of movies either, and I expect the WD to die soon, so I’ll get them a seagate when that happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

You could have probably saved on ram by going with just 2gb

psu is questionable

You should probably get a dedicated gpu esp. if you want HD (9400gt should be good)

I dont think that motherboard is all that great too

you also would have saved getting retail cpu with stock fan

doesn’t a media pc at least need a dvd rom drive?

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap media center computer
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

media center box? could go with some more storage.

well, depends on how avid your parents are i guess (now that i think of it i dont see them saving hundreds of gb of movies)

looks good though

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

I think I just made one for a very good deal for my parents (to use as a media computer, so they can download movies and watch them on their TV without burning them to DVDs), though I don’t think it would be too shabby for gaming for the price:

That also doesn’t count the $40 in mail in rebates, so the whole computer cost about $200, not too shabby I think.

(the hard drive that I was forced to buy with the combo was a Western Digital, so of course it was DOA (Dead on Arrival) and just made a clicking sound, so I have to RMA that and hope the next is better)

What do you guys think?
